text: Arthur Boni (21 October 1934 â€“ 24 December 2022) was a Belgian-Dutch actor. He was best known for his contributions to various television series including Medisch Centrum West, Goede Tijden, Slechte Tijden and 'Flikken Maastricht. ==Biography== Boni was born in 1934 in Antwerp. From 1957 he played as an actor in the Netherlands, and got the Dutch nationality. In the 1960s Boni played the Marquis of Karakoelikas in the at the time popular children's televirion series De avonturen van Okkie Trooy. In the 1970s, Boni played in among others Waaldrecht and Klaverweide. Later he had played in television series Medisch Centrum West, Spangen, Goede Tijden, Slechte Tijden, Rozengeur & Wodka Lime, Gooische Vrouwen, Flikken Maastricht and Juliana, prinses van Oranje. Boni was also voice actor, like in the television series of Alfred Jodocus Kwak. He also acted in films. In the 1977 movie Soldier of Orange he played the modest role of Otto. He also played as a stage actor in theaters. He was active as an actor until 2013, playing in the successfull movie De Kleinzoon. Later his health declined. Boni died in Amsterdam on 24 December 2022, at the age of 88. ==References== Category:Dutch television actors Category:Dutch movie actors Category:Dutch stage actors Category:1934 births Category:2022 deaths Category:People from Antwerp
